result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Oday M Said was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Oday M Said in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Steven Johnson-Forensic Specialist, appears in person. Parties have reviewed report and parties stipulate to the findings.

BTC: Mr. Said must reside with his mother, take all medications as prescribed, be compliant with psych care, receive support in counseling, no alc/cs or mind altering substances, 20 hrs structured social or vocational activities. Agent is Amy Arzikovic-Zenner. Deft to turn passport over to Mr. Johnson, Deft must be compliant with rules of mother's household.
Conditional release plan
Hearing on April 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
AMENDED (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) - amended from 12 years to 4 years and effective date is as of 03-13-2015.
per Judge Gasiorkiewicz off the record - commitment order to be amended and commitment to be ordered as of 03-13-2015 when plea was taken.

Defendant Oday M Said in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.

Mr. Johnson's opinion is that conditional release is appropriate. Ms. McClendon asks for only 3 years of supervision but she is in agreement with the determination of conditional release.

BTC: guilty as above. Conditional release is granted. Defendant will be supervised for 4 years. Conditions are as set forth in the report by Mr. Johnson.

ALONG WITH CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH MOTHER, NAHLA BADWAN, DOB 01-24-1963 WITH PHOTO ID AND SISTER, BAYANN SAID, DOB 05/23/1990 WITH PHOTO ID. Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). House arrest at mother's home at all times with exceptions only for doctor/health provider appointments, court appointments, and appointments with attorney. May leave the home for NGI evaluation. Must be compliant with taking any and all medications as prescribed including psychotropic medications. Defendant is to be totally compliant with any and all rules imposed by his mother. If there are any violations, both co-signers must report same to the Court. No firearms or any hunting weapons or knives in the home. Defendant may not possess, borrow, purchase, or lease them.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Competency hearing on January 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
NG plea entered.
Reading waived.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Oday M Said in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Oday M Said in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court has received a 11/25/2014 report filed by Dr. Pankiewicz. Parties have reviewed same. Parties stipulate to the findings of the report. The Court is aware of the CM cases and defense is asking to consolidate. Defense intends to enter NGI pleas in 14CF1530. The State does not object to consoldation in light of the information the Court has provided.

Defense asks to be heard on bond. Defense asks that bond be modified to signature or co-signature bond. Mom is Nahla Badwan 1-24-1963, sister is Bayann Said 05/23/1990. The Court conducts colloquy with mother and sister to be sure they understand their responsibilities as co-signers. The Court has reviewed the pro se motion filed by the deft for bond modification that states deft is currently under Ch. 51. The State objects to bond modification. The State does not know the facts of the other matters, but the felony matter is much more aggravated than Misd DC and the State is not sure that deft's family can control deft to ensure his safety and the safety of society. 

BTC: Defendant has been found competent to proceed. For judicial economy, the Court believes it best to consolidate cases but a consolidation order is to be done with approval from Judge Constantine. Copy of minutes from today's hearing to be sent to Br. 7.
            NGI PLEA ENTERED. EXAMINER TO BE APPOINTED

Bond to be modified to $5000.00 cash and $25000.00 co-signature bond with mother and sister. GPS/house arrest. Must stay in mother's home unless deft has doctor/psychiatrist or health care provider appointments, court appointments and appointments with attorney. May leave the home for NGI exam. Must be compliant with taking any and all psychotropic medications as prescribed. Defendant is to be totally compliant with any and all rules imposed by mother. If there are violations, both co-signers must report same to the Court. No firearms or any hunting weapons or knives in the home. Deft may not possess, borrow, purchase or lease them.
  Competency hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
